transcript: Aunty ji, when will you finish your tea? I am not able to do it right now. I have to make special masala for you. Really, I can't make masala. I don't know how to make masala. What work do you have? It's okay, Aunty ji. Both of us went to the kitchen and made masala. And today, I will make masala. Aunty ji, I will make masala for you. I don't know how to make masala. Aunty ji, I don't know how to make masala. Masala is ready. Masala is ready. Masala is ready. Thank you for watching. If you like this video, please subscribe to my channel. Thank you for watching.

evaluation.feedback: The speaker shows a reasonable level of English fluency, but seems to often repeat the same grammatical structures and vocabulary, which is indicative of a somewhat limited language range. Future development efforts should focus on expanding the speaker's vocabulary breadth and richness, understanding and using more complex grammatical structures, and work on pronunciation to allow for greater comprehensibility. Using a variety of sentence structure could also improve the discourse. Furthermore, the task completion was average as the speaker could expand their ideas a little more. However, the speaker demonstrated a clear message and was able to perform a communication task in English.
